text.0: come to the juice that we have pressed to soma indra bleat with milk.
text.1: come favouring us thy baydrawn car.
text.2: come indra to this gladdening drink placed on the grass pressed out with stones.
text.3: wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof.
text.4: to indra have my songs of praise gone forth thus rapidly sent hence.
text.5: to turn him to the somadraught.
text.6: hither with songs of praise we call indra to drink the soma juice.
text.7: will he not come to us by lauds.
text.8: indra these somas are expressed take them within thy belly lord.
text.9: of hundred powers thou prince of wealth.
text.10: we know thee winner of the spoil and resolute in battles sage.
text.12: borne hither by thy stallions drink indra this juice which we have pressed.
text.13: mingled with barley and with milk.
text.14: indra for thee in thine own place i urge the soma for thy draught.
text.15: deep in thy heart let it remain.
text.16: we call on thee the ancient one indra to drink the soma juice.
text.17: we kuśikas who seek thine aid.
